pros: This company truly feels like a family. The benefits are unmatched to any company I have ever worked for before.
cons: Sometimes the turnover is difficult due to the lower wages in a high cost of living area.

job_title: Vocational Rehabilitation Counselor in Hamilton, ON
pros: Good pay, awesome coworkers, great clients to work with.
cons: On call, so sometimes there were tons of calls and sometimes none.

pros: Very good support from direct supervisor. It's a small company, so you feel like part of the family.
cons: Compensation seemed to be lower than other non-profits in the area.

review_title: Wonderful community based non-profit making a real difference in Northern Virginia.
pros: Every employee has a voice and is encouraged to develop their skills and interests as it applies to moving the programs forward. There is lots of collaboration with other community organizations. There is a lot of chemistry between employees within the company.
cons: Direct service can be difficult. Compensation could be better, but then again, this is a private non-profit.

pros:
Family friendly employer with flexibility in scheduling
Collaborative work environment with participatory leadership style
Good vacation and holiday leave benefits
cons: Salary is lower as expected in community non-profit, however other benefits offer many advantages to someone raising a family

review_title: Most have a passion for helping
pros: Friendly work environment and dedicated staff working in the brain injury community.
